required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Ultrasound on Orthodontic Tooth Movement
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Ultrasound on Orthodontic Tooth Movement

brief_summary.textblock: To study whether or not the Aevo System™ medical device enhances the rate of tooth movement in human subjects who use orthodontic braces.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will involve comparing the effects of tooth movement with and without ultrasound treatment in a split mouth design. Treatment will consist of using the Aevo System™ device for one 20 minute period per day for the duration of the trial (up to 24 weeks). Tooth position measurements will be taken from eligible patients prior to commencing usage of the study device. Follow-up visits will be scheduled for intra-oral clinical measurements and to take full-arch impressions. The Aevo System™ consists of an ultrasound emitting mouthpiece which is wire connected to an external handheld device. The mouthpiece is placed over the teeth and over the braces every day for 20 minutes in order to deliver the therapy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
primary_outcome.description: The weekly rate of tooth movement (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
secondary_outcome.description: The weekly rate of tooth root resorption (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
secondary_outcome.description: Average measured level of subject discomfort or pain. The Participant Pain Reporting Scale is used to assess the amount of pain on a 10 point scale. On the 10 point scale, 1 represents the least amount of pain and 10 represents the most amount of pain.

arm_group.description: 20 minutes per day of ultrasound treatment on the active side of the device. The device consists of a mouth guard type device with transducers embedded in the mouth guard. In the split mouth design, the treatment arm consist of the side of the mouth with the transducers activated.

The transducers are not activated on the control side of the device.The subjects wear the device for 20 minutes per day for the duration of the study. The device consists of a mouth guard type device with transducers embedded in the mouth guard. In the split mouth design, the control arm consist of the side of the mouth with the transducers deactivated.

intervention.description: The Aevo System™ is an ultrasound emitting dental device.

Ultrasound not activated in the comparator side of the device.20 minutes per day of ultrasound treatment on the active side of the device. The device consists of a mouth guard type device with transducers embedded in the mouth guard. In the split mouth design, the treatment arm consist of the side of the mouth with the transducers activated while the comparator arm has the transducers deactivated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Subjects who meet all of the following criteria will qualify for entry into the study:
1. Scheduled to receive orthodontic treatment or in early stage of orthodontic treatment
2. Minimum of 3 mm of extraction space (on both sides of a dental arch) to be closed either by distal movement of all 6 anterior teeth from canine to canine or by distal movement of the canines.
3. Available for follow-up visits.
4. Willing and able to sign written informed consent.
5. Healthy.
6. Has permanent dentition and between the ages of 12 and 40.
7. Good oral hygiene and compliance
Exclusion Criteria:
Subjects who meet any of the following criteria will be excluded from the study:
1. Any compromised medical or dental condition that prevents the subject from participating in the trial or using the medical device.
2. Any implanted assistive devices.
3. Currently involved in any other study.
4. Lives significantly outside the clinical trial site.
5. Use of bisphosphonates.
6. Pregnant females .

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 11 subjects did not meet inclusion criteria after enrollment. For this reason, 60 subjects were enrolled but only 49 entered the participant flow.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: As per split mouth design, one side of the mouth received treatment while the other side of the mouth served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

participants_list.participants: 11 out of 60 subjects did not meet inclusion criteria after enrollment.

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: As per split mouth design, one side of the mouth received treatment while the other side of the mouth served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

outcome.title: Rate of Tooth Movement
outcome.description: The weekly rate of tooth movement (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.
outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
outcome.population: As per approved protocol, only subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher and with functional devices were evaluated.

group.title: Treatment Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that received treatment. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

group.title: Control Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that was the control. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

measure.title: Rate of Tooth Movement
measure.description: The weekly rate of tooth movement (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.
measure.population: As per approved protocol, only subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher and with functional devices were evaluated.

analysis.estimate_desc: Percent change in tooth movement rate on the treatment side as compared to the control side.

outcome.title: Rate of Root Resorption
outcome.description: The weekly rate of tooth root resorption (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.
outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
outcome.population: Subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher and with functional devices were evaluated. Only subjects with CBCT images were used.

group.title: Treatment Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that received treatment. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

group.title: Control Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that was the control. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

measure.title: Rate of Root Resorption
measure.description: The weekly rate of tooth root resorption (mm/week) as compared between the treated side and the control side.
measure.population: Subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher and with functional devices were evaluated. Only subjects with CBCT images were used.

analysis.estimate_desc: Percent change in root resorption rate on the control side as compared to the treatment side.

outcome.title: Discomfort
outcome.description: Average measured level of subject discomfort or pain. The Participant Pain Reporting Scale is used to assess the amount of pain on a 10 point scale. On the 10 point scale, 1 represents the least amount of pain and 10 represents the most amount of pain.
outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks or until the extraction space was closed (whichever came first)
outcome.population: Subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher.

group.title: Treatment Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that received treatment. As per split mouth design, one side of the mouth received treatment while the other side of the mouth served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

group.title: Control Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that was the control. As per split mouth design, one side of the mouth received treatment while the other side of the mouth served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

measure.title: Discomfort
measure.description: Average measured level of subject discomfort or pain. The Participant Pain Reporting Scale is used to assess the amount of pain on a 10 point scale. On the 10 point scale, 1 represents the least amount of pain and 10 represents the most amount of pain.
measure.population: Subjects who completed the study with device usage compliance of 67% or higher.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: 1 point on the 10-point pain scale was used as the non-inferiority margin.
analysis.method_desc: This test bootstrapped the mean difference (Treatment Arm – Control Arm) less 1, the non-inferiority margin, 1000 times.

reported_events.time_frame: The duration of the study, up to 24 weeks.

group.title: Treatment Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that received treatment. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

group.title: Control Arm
group.description: The side of the mouth that was the control. As per split mouth design, one side received treatment while the other side served as the control. In this design, each subject was both treated and served as control.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
